title: How did USA became more powerful than UK? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is a long and short answer to this question, as there are with many questions. In short, the U.S.A. circa 1930, was a weak power due to The Great Depression. They boosted their economy significantly by expanding their industry to support their total war plan for W.W.II. This launched them into a position to convert those factories that we're churning out tanks into Coca-Cola Plants, etc. In Britain, we have a better off, healthier economy, but their continued involvement in WW II slowly ground on them, with constant bombings, aimed at their industrial centers, making it difficult for them to continue supplying jobs at the rate they had prior. This is a very simplified answer. if we compound in this, and take into account the MIC (military-industrial complex), something America has used to its advantage for years now, or the difference in the size of these two nations, we can see the overwhelming differences that arise. And when we take into account the loss of Britains many annexed (and I use that term in the loosest of senses), nations, Britains sovereign territory decreases immensely. With this, comes a significant increase in reliance on foreign materials, which wasnt a problem for the U.S.A, as their large size provided vast tracts of resources to enable a vast expansion of its industry, which, through it's later interactions around the globe, led to the U.S.A becoming the world power we know it as today.
